content:
ContentElementAutomationPeer Class

Definition

Exposes ContentElement types to UI Automation.

In this Article

public class ContentElementAutomationPeer : System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer
Inheritance
Object
DispatcherObject
System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer
ContentElementAutomationPeer

Constructors

ContentElementAutomationPeer(ContentElement)

Initializes a new instance of the ContentElementAutomationPeer class.

public ContentElementAutomationPeer (System.Windows.ContentElement owner);
owner
ContentElement

The ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer.

Properties

Owner

Gets the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer.

public System.Windows.ContentElement Owner { get; }
Value
ContentElement

The ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer.

Methods

CreatePeerForElement(ContentElement)

Creates a ContentElementAutomationPeer for the specified ContentElement.

public static System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer CreatePeerForElement (System.Windows.ContentElement element);
element
ContentElement

The ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer.

Returns
System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

The ContentElementAutomationPeer for the specified ContentElement.

Remarks

This ContentElementAutomationPeer remains in memory until the associated ContentElement is destroyed.

The same instance of the ContentElementAutomationPeer is returned from subsequent calls to this method and to calls to FromElement. The type of the peer is determined by the OnCreateAutomationPeer virtual callback. If FrameworkContentElement does not implement the callback, no ContentElementAutomationPeer is created and this method returns null.

FromElement(ContentElement)

Gets the ContentElementAutomationPeer for the specified ContentElement.

public static System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer FromElement (System.Windows.ContentElement element);
element
ContentElement

The ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer.

Returns
System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

The ContentElementAutomationPeer for the specified ContentElement, or null if the ContentElementAutomationPeer has not been created by the stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer.CreatePeerForElement* method.

GetAcceleratorKeyCore()

Gets the accelerator key for the element associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey*.

protected override string GetAcceleratorKeyCore ();
Returns
String

An String string.

GetAccessKeyCore()

Gets the access key for the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey*.

protected override string GetAccessKeyCore ();
Returns
String

The access key for this ContentElement.

GetAutomationControlTypeCore()

Gets the control type for the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType*.

protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType GetAutomationControlTypeCore ();
Returns
AutomationControlType

The AutomationControlType enumeration value.

GetAutomationIdCore()

Gets the string that uniquely identifies the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId*.

protected override string GetAutomationIdCore ();
Returns
String

A string containing the automation identifier.

Remarks

The value of the automation identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property, and if that isn't set, it's the Name property.

GetBoundingRectangleCore()

Gets the Rect representing the bounding rectangle of the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle*.

protected override System.Windows.Rect GetBoundingRectangleCore ();
Returns
Rect

The bounding rectangle.

GetChildrenCore()

Gets the collection of child elements of the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren*.

protected override System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> GetChildrenCore ();
Returns
List<AutomationPeer>

The collection of child elements.

GetClassNameCore()

Gets the name of the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName*.

protected override string GetClassNameCore ();
Returns
String

An String string.

GetClickablePointCore()

Gets a Point that represents the clickable space that is on the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint*.

protected override System.Windows.Point GetClickablePointCore ();
Returns
Point

The point that represents the clickable space that is on the element.

Remarks

For example, if the element is a Button, the clickable point is any point that is within the visible client area of the Button that would result in issuing the command that the button represents, when the user clicks the Button by using the mouse.

GetHelpTextCore()

Gets the string that describes the functionality of the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText*.

protected override string GetHelpTextCore ();
Returns
String

The string that describes the functionality of the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer.

Remarks

The string that is returned generally is the same text that is provided in the tooltip for the control.

GetItemStatusCore()

Gets a string that conveys the visual status of the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus*.

protected override string GetItemStatusCore ();
Returns
String

A string containing the status.

Remarks

For example, the status of a messenger contact could be "Busy" or "Online".

GetItemTypeCore()

Gets a human-readable string that contains the type of the item that the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer represents. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType*.

protected override string GetItemTypeCore ();
Returns
String

The string that contains the item type.

Remarks

Examples are "Mail Message", "Contact", and "Document".

GetLabeledByCore()

Gets the AutomationPeer for the Label that is targeted to the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy*.

protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer GetLabeledByCore ();
Returns
System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

The LabelAutomationPeer for the element that is targeted by the Label.

Remarks

For example, if the element is a ComboBox control, the GetLabeledBy method could get the AutomationPeer for the Label that is associated with the ComboBox.

GetNameCore()

Gets the text label of the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName*.

protected override string GetNameCore ();
Returns
String

The string that contains the label.

Remarks

The name property can be thought of as the string of text that a user would use to explain which control is being referred to. It is important to have a textual representation for all controls in the graphical user interface (GUI) so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.

GetOrientationCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer is laid out in a specific direction. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation*.

protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation GetOrientationCore ();
Returns
AutomationOrientation

The AutomationOrientation enumeration value.

GetPattern(PatternInterface)

Gets the control pattern for the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer.

public override object GetPattern (System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface patternInterface);
patternInterface
PatternInterface

One of the enumeration values.

Returns
Object

An object that implements the ISynchronizedInputProvider interface if patternInterface is PatternInterface; otherwise, null.

HasKeyboardFocusCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer currently has keyboard input focus. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus*.

protected override bool HasKeyboardFocusCore ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the element has keyboard input focus; otherwise, false.

IsContentElementCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer is an element that contains data that is presented to the user. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement*.

protected override bool IsContentElementCore ();
Returns
Boolean

false.

IsControlElementCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer is something that the end user would understand as being interactive or as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the GUI. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement*.

protected override bool IsControlElementCore ();
Returns
Boolean

false.

IsEnabledCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether this automation peer can receive and send events to the associated element. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsEnabled*.

protected override bool IsEnabledCore ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the automation peer can receive and send events; otherwise, false.

IsKeyboardFocusableCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer can accept keyboard focus. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable*.

protected override bool IsKeyboardFocusableCore ();
Returns
Boolean

false.

IsOffscreenCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer is off of the screen. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen*.

protected override bool IsOffscreenCore ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, an element can be on the screen but still not be visible, for example if the element is obscured by other elements. In this case the method would return false.

IsPasswordCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer contains protected content. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword*.

protected override bool IsPasswordCore ();
Returns
Boolean

false.

IsRequiredForFormCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer is required to be filled out on a form. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm*.

protected override bool IsRequiredForFormCore ();
Returns
Boolean

false.

SetFocusCore()

Sets the keyboard input focus on the ContentElement that is associated with this ContentElementAutomationPeer. Called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus*.

protected override void SetFocusCore ();
